reviews.review_msg: I actually really enjoyed 8:30 morning lectures with Leah when I took this course in Fall 2014. She always had funny, embarrassing stories to tell the class. The content is pretty detailed and interesting, but you have to study hard to memorize everything. Her assignments were easy and straightforward if you followed the instructions properly.

Lectures are dreadful and boring. The assignments are easy if you follow the examples properly. A lot of people disregarded them and ending up doing bad on them. The exams are okay, you have to study it isn't common sense. Just use the website provided and quiz yourself!!
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER. SHE TESTS RIDICULOUSLY AND RAMBLES ON ABOUT USELESS STORIES. YOU END UP WITH TWO LETER GRADES LOWER AFTER THE FINAL
Funny, embarrassing stories during lecture. Animated and laid-back. Test are somewhat difficult.

The most boring class I've ever had in four years. Didn't learn anything from lectures. Did well despite not attending class and got accused of cheating as a result. Should have gotten an A- but got a B because she apparently changed the grading scheme last minute. Kept saying she couldn't help me because she was going away.

Leah is a good professor. She posts powerpoint notes online but she doesn't explain them in-depth in lectures, so you will need to spend lots of time on your own learning the material. Midterm and final are straight forward, if you study her  lecture notes you should do fine. There is an assignment worth 30% which is easy but very time consuming.

bpk 110 is very detailed in that you have to know sources of food and RDAs of the food groups. She's not that great at teaching and kind of boring but her exams are alright, if you can, take it with someone else.
Very hard class. Don't even bother reading from textbook its way too long and boring. Study off Lecture notes and  u should be able to get at least a C+.

She spends too much time talking about things not related to the course content at all. Constantly makes jokes only she laughs at. Lectures teach basic stuff but she expects you to know everything, avoid avoid avoid avoid

All you need to do is study her lecture slides. Midterm and final were hard, but the class must be scaled because you can do well without getting good grades on either. Spend a lot of time on the assignment as it is worth a lot, and easy to do well on.
The poor quality of this professor is a good example of the declination of our education system.

Let me put it this way: Leah + BPK110 = bad BPK110; you're basically memorizing the text. The TA Rodrigo, he was ok, difficult to understand & made simple questions/answers into Mt. Everest, like why?!  Just go with Bedoya or take the risk of a GPA slashing nightmare!

The class has interesting material but Leah manages to put the entire class to sleep by reciting the lecture slides word for word. Assignments in this class are completely useless in real life applications. Final is basically a memory dump.

Take this course with anyone other than Leah. Lecture slides were incorrect and when presented, was nonchalant, like seriously? Veers off topic during and a little condescending. Midterm = ok. Final = difficult (coming from a 3.50+ GPA student). Text is good, read it; the material is relevant and interesting. It's the instruction that is poor.

Leah could teach the material very well if only she talk about useful things that related to NUTRITION! Majority of lectures she would go off-topic and discuss things that had no relation to the class. She defends her point too much, didn't listen to students explanation if they asked for marks on an assignment or exam.
Schedules a midterm during a Canada vs. USA Olympic hockey game... Enough said.
attend class if you want to hear stories about her life and not actual material. Horrible at explaining and not helpful.
One of the worst profs ever. Very inconsistent notes, lecture doesn't add anything to the textbooks, makes the TA do all the work. Avoid avoid avoid!!!
Terrible jokes all class long, talks to students like kindergarten kids.
Great prof! The best Kin prof I've had at SFU!!! The material wasn't too difficult but if you ever had a question she was more than willing to help out! Great Prof for Kin 110 and 142 as well!

Leah was fantastic. She was easy to approach and took time to re-explain concepts. She was the Lab TA for KIN 142, and was so much fun! Her suggestion to buy the Anatomy Colouring book is a VERY good one, especially for visual learners. Her Lab was very well correlated with lectures.

Just go through lecture slides and webct study questions and you'll be fine, you won't even have to attend all the lectures. Tutorials seem to be mostly about clarifying diet analysis, ton of material but very relevant. Midterm time allotment was frustrating but final seemed ok. Not an easy A but it's probably worth it to take the class anyway.

High interest in the subject, huge amount of studying for her final. Midterm was fairly easy but only 50 minutes to write, then lecture afterward... Useless quizzes to start every tutorial. Diet analysis is interesting but tedious, due every couple of weeks. Her jokes are well... crickets. Prepare to be patronized about webCT to start every class.
